scheme_name: Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan Yojana: Central Sector Interest Subsidy Scheme
description: The Central Sector Interest Subsidy Scheme under the Pradhan Mantri Uchchatar Shiksha Protsahan Yojana provides full interest subsidy on education loans during the moratorium period for students pursuing technical or professional courses in India. The scheme aims to support economically weaker sections by reducing the financial burden of loan interest, enabling access to higher education.
key_features: Full interest subsidy during the moratorium period
Applicable to loans taken under the Indian Banksâ€™ Association (IBA) Model Education Loan Scheme
Targets students from economically weaker sections

education_criteria: Students enrolled in professional/technical courses approved by AICTE, UGC, or equivalent bodies
Courses must be at graduate or postgraduate level
additional_criteria: Annual family income must not exceed Rs. 4.5 Lakhs
Loan must be availed from a scheduled bank under IBA Model Education Loan Scheme
eligibility.admission_requirement: Admission through merit-based selection or entrance test
institution_criteria: Recognized institutions in India approved by AICTE, UGC, or other regulatory bodies

eligible_courses_delhi: Engineering, medical, law, management, and other professional courses
Technical courses like B.Tech, B.Arch, MBBS, etc.

steps: Apply for an education loan through a scheduled bank under IBA Model Education Loan Scheme
Submit income certificate and other required documents to the bank
Bank forwards application for interest subsidy to the nodal agency (Canara Bank)
Subsidy credited to loan account upon approval
application_process.note: Applications processed through banks; contact bank for specific procedures

required_documents.note: To prove family income below Rs. 4.5 Lakhs

special_notes: Subsidy available only for loans up to Rs. 7.5 Lakhs
Applicable only during moratorium period; post-moratorium interest is borne by the student
Students availing other scholarships/subsidies may still be eligible, subject to bank discretion
